text: hi guys today I'm going to make a great
make-ahead breakfast because baked
french toast with blueberries so it's
super seasonal super delicious and super
easy because most of the work is done
ahead of time you want to slice up a
loaf of brioche or you can buy
pre-sliced you need ten slices about a
half an inch thick each so I have about
ten this loaf is actually about 12
ounces in the whole recipe calls for 10
so I'm not going to use the entire thing
here I have 6 large eggs here break them
apart start whisking them and then add 3
cups of milk half a teaspoon of cinnamon
1/2 teaspoon of kosher salt and 1/3 of a
cup of sugar all of those ingredients
get just whipped together to make your
custard and then you soak your bread in
the custard now what you want to do is
arrange your bread in a 2 quart baking
dish but the first you do is dip each
piece into the custard mixture before
putting it into a nicely buttered baking
dish you do
slightly shingled overlapping layers for
this one I would say 2 rows of 5 these
kinds of baked breakfast things baked
french toast strata stuff like that are
so great when you have guests coming
over or you have a brunch that you're
hosting because you make it ahead you
just let it sit in the refrigerator you
can sit for 30 minutes look and it can
also sit for up to overnight so it's
very versatile then you just pour the
rest of the egg mixture over the top and
what's going to happen is it will soak
into the bread absorb and come on a
sturdy and amazing later when it bakes
to just get this into the refrigerator
and let it sit a minimum of 30 minutes
but it's totally fine to do up to
overnight so after about 30 minutes or
up to overnight you can add your
blueberries 1 cup of blueberries you can
sprinkle them over the top
I like to get blueberries in every bite
so I sprinkle them between the layers
depending on how long you'd let this
soak it will be more or less absorbed if
you've done it overnight you might not
see any liquid hair if you've done it
for 35 or 45 minutes you'll still see
some liquid in the place your oven is at
325 degrees and you get this in there
and bake it until it's puffed and set
that will take 55 to 60 minutes it's
ready to eat it's cooled about 15-20
minutes you can sprinkle the top with
some confectioners sugar you can serve
this with maple syrup you can make a
blueberry syrup if you want that you can
double up on your blueberry but it's
very very pretty
such a great entertaining dish I think
some up nice and custardy but not soggy
I'm not a fan of SuperDuper soggy but
this is rose that crispy a little bit on
top and creamy in the center which i
think is a great combination bright hits
of freshness for the blueberries thank
you guys are really going to love this
one
[Music]
